definition: to reinstate/to resume/to restore/to recover/to regain/to rehabilitate
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
to restore sth to its original state
to rehabilitate/to regain one's good name

sentences.english: All patients recovered after operation except 1 case died of diabetes insipidus.
sentences.chinese: 绝大多数患者手术后恢复良好，仅1例死于尿崩症。

sentences.english: We won't have Nesta, Dida, Serginho or Favalli until after the break, Gattuso is recovering well and could be back before the break.
sentences.chinese: 而加图索也在很快的恢复，他也将在冬歇期过后归队。

sentences.english: She recovered consciousness soon after the accident.
sentences.chinese: 她很快从打击中恢复过来。

sentences.english: Rwanda is far from fully recovered.
sentences.chinese: 卢旺达离完全恢复还很远。

sentences.english: It need quite a long time return to the former stability after rain, 5.
sentences.chinese: 降雨过后相当长时间，滑坡才能恢复到雨前的稳定性。

sentences.english: According to this, germplasms were classified into two types, that was maintainer lines and restoring lines .
sentences.chinese: 据此将香稻资源分为保持系和恢复系两类。

sentences.english: Nebuchadnezzar returned to his right mind only after he looked up to heaven.
sentences.chinese: 尼布甲尼撒举目望天之后才恢复了理智。

sentences.english: Her behavior returned to normal after the quake.
sentences.chinese: 她的举止在地震结束后就恢复了正常。

sentences.english: The fields have reverted to moorland .
sentences.chinese: 这些田地又恢复成荒地。

sentences.english: We are not yet back to trend growth levels.
sentences.chinese: 我们仍未能恢复到增长水平。

sentences.english: The discomfort subsides gradually over one or two weeks, leaving the joint apparently normal, and pain-free.
sentences.chinese: 不适感会在一到两周内逐渐减弱，直到关节恢复正常。

sentences.english: Filter can be fully restored after the Qing brush water flow.
sentences.chinese: 滤芯清刷后可完全恢复水流量。

sentences.english: Restore luster to the skin, the beauty parlor every week or self-massage time.
sentences.chinese: 令肌肤恢复光泽，每周可以到美容院或自行按摩一次。

sentences.english: He restored the traditional chanting and created more opportunities for monastics to propagate the Dharma by means of chanting.
sentences.chinese: 不但恢复传统梵呗也同时培养了更多梵呗高僧来传播。

sentences.english: It also wipes out the system restore with a reset, making it harder to recover the system.
sentences.chinese: 它还清除掉系统还原设置，使其难以恢复系统。

sentences.english: Recently returned to its original "Parade of Progress" configuration and colors.
sentences.chinese: 最近它被恢复到原来的“游骑兵计划”设置与喷漆。

definition: to restore/to renovate/restoration/(computing) to fix (a bug)
to restore (sth) to (its) former condition/to recover from illness/recovery
to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
to recover completely (from illness or injury)
to remove/to sack/to get rid of/to relieve (sb of their duties)/to free/to lift (an embargo)/to rescind (an agreement)
